intro: Schroeterella tridentata, commonly known as the three-toothed spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. The plant has a succulent, branching stem and produces small, triangular leaves with three distinct lobes. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Schroeterella tridentata is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many other spurge species.
